intro: Agalinis stenophylla, commonly known as narrow-leaf false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as sandhill prairies and disturbed soils. Its flowers are usually pink to purple and are arranged in a spike-like cluster. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, giving the plant its common name.
